definition: without support/helpless
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to help/to assist/to aid
isolated and without help

sentences.english: Still, I shook with a mixture of aloneness and terror.
sentences.chinese: 但是我依旧瑟瑟发抖，因为我孤立无援，充满恐惧。

sentences.english: At this moment it suddenly occurred to him how completely alone they were.
sentences.chinese: 他突然意识到他们此刻多么地孤立无援。

sentences.english: Custom hedged her in and made her helpless.
sentences.chinese: 习惯势力限制了她并使她孤立无援。

sentences.english: Impoverished, war-weary Africans locally are on their own.
sentences.chinese: 贫困，厌战的非洲人孤立无援。

sentences.english: On many of these populist measures, France is isolated.
sentences.chinese: 在许多民粹主义的举措上，法国孤立无援。

sentences.english: Piteous , helpless, animal groans came from the next room.
sentences.chinese: 从门后可以听见悲惨的孤立无援的动物的呻吟。

sentences.english: "The quilombo movement is still very timid, " Pinto said.
sentences.chinese: ‘歌伦波’运动仍然是孤立无援的，”Pinto说。

sentences.english: To believe is to know we are not alonge.
sentences.chinese: 信念就是明白我们并非孤立无援。

sentences.english: Ume's work travels around the world in gallery shows, but performs just as well as stand-alone photographs sent around as Internet gags.
sentences.chinese: 她的作品遍布世界，却在互联网的世界里孤立无援。

sentences.english: He doesn't bring you out on a limb and then cut off the limb.
sentences.chinese: 他没有把你带到孤立无援的窘境，而又把后路切断。

definition: isolated and without help
to stand a siege/trapped in a besieged city
helpless/helplessness/feeling useless/no help
lit. lone army putting up a brave fight (idiom)/fig. (of a person or group of people) struggling hard without support
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
the multitude against the few, a wide disparity (idiom from Mencius); heavily outnumbered/unequally matched/overwhelmed by weight of numbers
no one to rely on (idiom); on one's own/orphaned/left to one's own devices
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
variant of 孤苦伶仃[gu1 ku3 ling2 ding1]
lit. on all sides, the songs of Chu (idiom)/fig. surrounded by enemies, isolated and without help
to be beleaguered
beset by hunger and cold (idiom)/starving and freezing/in desperate poverty
in deep water/difficult situation
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
